item.title: Approximate Task Tree Retrieval in a Knowledge Network for Robotic Cooking
item.description: TL;DR – In this paper, we introduce the idea of connecting FOONs to robotic task and motion planning. We automatically transform a FOON graph, which exists at the object level (i.e., it is a representation that uses meaningful labels or expressions close to human language), into task planning specifications written in PDDL (not a very intuitive way to communicate about tasks).

item.title: Robot Learning of Assembly Tasks from Non-expert Demonstrations using Functional Object-Oriented Network
item.description: TL;DR – This was a collaboration with Clemson University’s Yunyi Jia and Yi Chen, who were interested in using FOONs for representing assembly tasks. They successfully utilized and adapted a FOON to robotic assembly execution.

item.title: Task Planning with a Weighted Functional Object-Oriented Network
item.description: TL;DR – In this paper, we attempt to execute task plan sequences extracted from FOONs. However, these sequences may contain actions that are not executable by a robot. Therefore, a human is introduced in the planning and execution loop, and both the robot and human assistant work together to solve the task.

item.title: Functional Object-Oriented Network: Construction & Expansion
item.description: TL;DR – In this paper, we explore methods in natural language processing (NLP) – specifically semantic similarity – for expanding or generalizing knowledge contained in a FOON. This alleviates the need for demonstrating and annotating graphs by other means.
